sen.j: 干物（ひもの、英語 Dried fish）とは、魚などの魚介類の身を干した加工食品。
sen.e: Himono (dried fish) is a generic term for cured foods made by drying various sea food such as fish.
Himono (dried fish) is a generic term for processed foods made by drying various sea foods such as fish.
Himono (dried fish) is a generic term for processed foods made by drying various sea foods such as fish.

sen.j: 干すことで表面に固い膜を作り、保存性が高まる。
sen.e: When dried, the surface of seafood looks hard and dry which ensures better shelf life.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Drying makes the surface of seafood become hard, which ensures a better shelf life.
sen.cmt: looks→becomeWhen dried,→Drying makesand dry→削除hard の後にカンマbetter→a better
sen.e: Drying makes the surface of seafood become hard, which ensures a better shelf life.

sen.j: また、独特の食感とそれに伴う食味も形成される。
sen.e: The drying process also adds the distinct texture and flavor to the seafood.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The drying process also makes the distinct texture and taste to the seafood.
The drying process also makes the distinct texture and taste to the seafood.

sen.j: 身を開き、内臓を取り除いてから干す加工法が一般的だが、いわしなど小型の魚はそのまま干して「丸干し」として食用に供することもある。
sen.e: Fish is generally cleaned, butterflied and dried but small fish such as sardines, however, are normally dried whole and served as 'Maruboshi'(dried whole fish).
Fish is generally cleaned, butterflied and dried but small fish such as sardines are normally dried whole and served as 'Maruboshi'(dried whole fish).
Fish is generally cleaned, butterflied and dried but small fish such as sardines are normally dried whole and served as 'Maruboshi'(dried whole fish).

sen.j: 魚が豊富に捕れる地域で行われる加工法であり、日本のみならず世界各国で作られている。
sen.e: It is a common curing method used in areas where there is a large volume of fish catches and dried fish is being produced in all the countries around the world in addition to Japan.
It is a common processing method used in areas where there is a large volume of fish catches and dried fish is being produced in all the countries around the world in addition to Japan.
This is a common processing method used in areas where there is a large volume of fish caught and dried fish is being produced in countries around the world in addition to Japan.

sen.j: 日本ではご飯、味噌汁、漬物、卵焼き、海苔と並んで和食の朝食には欠かせない一品である。
sen.e: In Japan, along with rice, miso soup, pickles, Japanese omelet and nori seaweed sheet, dried fish is one of the essential items on the breakfast table.
Aong with rice, miso soup, pickles, Japanese omelet and nori seaweed sheet, dried fish is one of the essential items on the breakfast table in Japan.
sen.cmt: in Japan 文末にしました。
sen.e: Aong with rice, miso soup, pickles, Japanese omelet and nori seaweed sheet, dried fish is one of the essential items on the breakfast table in Japan.

sen.j: また全国の海辺では土産品としてよく使われている。
sen.e: It is also popular as souveniers in the oceanfront areas throughout Japan.
It is also popular as a souvenier in the oceanfront areas throughout Japan.
It is also popular as a souvenier in the oceanfront areas throughout Japan.

sen.j: 同じ魚介類の乾燥品としては乾物もあるが、乾物は身の一部または全てを完全乾燥させて作られている。
sen.e: Kanbutsu (dry food) is another form of dried seafood but is made by thoroughly drying part or whole seafood.
Kanbutsu (dry food) is another form of dried seafood but is made by thoroughly drying part or whole seafood.
Kanbutsu (dry food) is another form of dried seafood, but is made by thoroughly drying part of it, or the whole seafood.

sen.j: 干物は風通しを特に重要視するため、乾燥した空気が吹き込む冬場の物が美味しいとされている。
sen.e: Ventilation is considered particularly important when making dried fish whereby it is believed that the best dried fish is made when it is exposed to the blowing dry air in winter.
Ventilation is considered particularly important when making dried fish whereby it is believed that the best dried fish is made when it is exposed to the blowing dry air in winter.
Ventilation is considered particularly important when making dried fish and it is believed that the best dried fish is produced when it is exposed to dry air blowing in winter.

sen.j: また、夏場は日光に当てると煮立ってしまい美味しさを損ねる。
sen.e: In summer, the heat of the intense sun cooks fish spoiling its flavor.
In summer, the heat of the intense sun cooks fish spoiling its flavor.
In summer, the intense heat of the sun cooks the fish spoiling its flavor.

sen.j: この為日陰干しが美味しいと言われている。
sen.e: In view of the foregoing, it is said that shade-dried fish tastes better.
In view of the foregoing, it is said that shade-dried fish tastes better.
In view of the foregoing, it is said that shade-dried fish tastes better.

sen.j: 実際に天日干しと言っても１時間程度干すだけであとは影にて干す事が多い。
sen.e: Even when the term 'drying in the sun' is used, it is common to dry fish in the sun for approximately 1 hour and is then brought in the shade for the rest of drying process.
Even when the term 'drying in the sun' is used, it is common to dry fish in the sun for approximately one hour and is then brought in the shade for the rest of drying process.
Even when the term 'drying in the sun' is used, it is common to dry fish in the sun for approximately one hour and then placed into the shade for the rest of drying process.

sen.j: 本稿の写真では天日で干しているが、その時間も短時間で、干したあと1時間程度で直ぐに販売される。
sen.e: The photograph accompanying this article shows fish drying in the sun but fish stays in the sun for a very brief period of time and, approximately in an hour after being dried, fish will become available for sale.

The photograph accompanying this article shows fish drying in the sun but fish stays in the sun for a very brief period of time and, approximately in an hour after being dried, fish will become available for sale.

The photograph accompanying this article shows fish drying in the sun, but they remain in the sun for a very brief period and approximately one hour after being dried, the fish will be available to sell.

sen.j: 昔からの干物である。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This method has been done since olden days.
This method has been done since olden days.

sen.j: 保存性を重視し細菌類の繁殖を抑えるため、長い日数をかけて干し、かなりの水分を抜いていたが、風味が抜け身が硬くなり食感が悪くなる欠点がある。
sen.e: With this long-standing method, the importance is placed on an extended shelf-life of the product whereby, to control the growth of bacteria, seafood is dried for days to remove substantial amount of water resulting in disadvantages that the finished product is less flavorful, is tough and has unattractive texture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: With this long-standing method, the importance is placed on an extended shelf-life of the product whereby, to control the growth of bacteria, seafood is dried for days to remove substantial amount of water resulting in disadvantages that the finished product is less flavorful, is tough and has unattractive texture.

With this long-standing method, the importance is placed upon extending the shelf-life of the product and to control the growth of bacteria seafood is dried for days to remove a substantial amount of water resulting in the disadvantage of the finished product having less flavor, is tough, and has an unattractive texture.

sen.j: ほとんどの干物では天日乾燥が基本であり、最近では虫付きを防ぎ乾燥を早めるため、つり下げた魚を回転させる干し台が作られている。
sen.e: In most cases, sun drying is the basic method for making dried fish and, in recent years, rotating drying racks for hanging fish to keep insects away and to accelerate the drying process have become available.

sen.j: 一昼夜塩漬けしたのち天日で乾燥させる。
sen.e: After soaking in brine for 24 hours, dry in the sun.
